feed.title: Security Advisory for Python packages hosted at PyPI.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for Python packages hosted at PyPI.org on GitHub

entry.title: [ctx] Malware in ctx
entry.content:
The ctx hosted project on PyPI was taken over via user account compromise and replaced with a malicious project which contained runtime code that collected the content of os.environ.items() when instantiating Ctx objects. The captured environment variables were sent as a base64 encoded query parameter to a heroku application running at https://anti-theft-web.herokuapp.com.

If you installed the package between May 14, 2022 and May 24, 2022, and your environment variables contain sensitive data like passwords and API keys (like AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY), we advise you to rotate your passwords and keys, then perform an audit to determine if they were exploited.

References

  • https://github.com/figlief/ctx
  • https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/ctx+Python+Library+Updated+with+Extra+Features/28678/
  • https://portswigger.net/daily-swig/malicious-python-library-ctx-removed-from-pypi-repo
  • https://python-security.readthedocs.io/pypi-vuln/index-2022-05-24-ctx-domain-takeover.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4g82-3jcr-q52w

entry.title: [ujson] Out-of-bounds Write in ujson
entry.content:
UltraJSON (aka ujson) 1.34 through 5.1.0 has a stack-based buffer overflow in Buffer_AppendIndentUnchecked (called from encode).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-45958
  • https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=36009
  • https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz-vulns/blob/main/vulns/ujson/OSV-2021-955.yaml
  • https://github.com/ultrajson/ultrajson/issues/501
  • https://github.com/ultrajson/ultrajson/issues/502#issuecomment-1031747284
  • https://github.com/ultrajson/ultrajson/pull/504
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/02/msg00023.html
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/CN7W3GOXALINKFUUE7ICQIC2EF5HNKUQ/
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/O6JUWQTJLA2CMG4CJN7DCUVSOXLZIIXL/
  • https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ULX35TSWLBBIMEH44MUORPXYYRZKEDC6/
  • https://github.com/ultrajson/ultrajson/pull/519
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fh56-85cw-5pq6

entry.title: [pysaml2] Moderate severity vulnerability that affects pysaml2
entry.content:
Python package pysaml2 version 4.5.0 and earlier reuses the initialization vector across encryptions in the IDP server, resulting in weak encryption of data.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000246
  • https://github.com/rohe/pysaml2/issues/417
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cq94-qf6q-mf2h
  • https://github.com/IdentityPython/pysaml2/pull/519/commits/7323f5c20efb59424d853c822e7a26d1aa3e84aa

entry.title: [url_regex] Regular expression denial of service in url_regex
entry.content:
All versions of package url-regex are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) which can cause the CPU usage to crash.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-21195
  • https://github.com/AlexFlipnote/url_regex/blob/master/url_regex/url_regex.py
  • https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PYTHON-URLREGEX-2347643
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hg3w-7hj9-m3f7

entry.title: [calibreweb] SQL injection in calibreweb
entry.content:
Calibre-Web before 0.6.18 allows user table SQL Injection.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-30765
  • https://github.com/janeczku/calibre-web/blob/master/SECURITY.md
  • https://github.com/janeczku/calibre-web/releases/tag/0.6.18
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8ppf-x4gr-2x7g

entry.title: [OctoPrint] Cross-site Scripting in OctoPrint
entry.content:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Generic in GitHub repository octoprint/octoprint prior to 1.8.0. The Stream URL of octoprint application allowing a xss payload to execute.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-1432
  • https://github.com/octoprint/octoprint/commit/6d259d7e6f5b0de9a1c762831537a386e53978d3
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/cb545c63-a3c1-4d57-8f06-e4593ab389bf
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h8pc-j334-jjhm

entry.title: [OctoPrint] Cross-site Scripting in OctoPrint
entry.content:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - DOM in GitHub repository octoprint/octoprint prior to 1.8.0. The login endpoint allows for javascript injection which may lead to account takeover in a phishing scenario.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-1430
  • https://github.com/octoprint/octoprint/commit/8087528e4a7ddd15c7d95ff662deb5ef7de90045
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/0cd30d71-1e32-4a0b-b4c3-faaa1907b541
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x7r7-wmj8-vv5g

entry.title: [admesh] Out-of-bounds read in admesh
entry.content:
ADMesh through 0.98.4 has a heap-based buffer over-read in stl_update_connects_remove_1 (called from stl_remove_degenerate) in connect.c in libadmesh.a.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-25033
  • https://github.com/admesh/admesh/issues/28
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/05/msg00029.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5jrq-582v-9767

entry.title: [apache-superset] SQL injection in apache-superset
entry.content:
Apache Superset before 1.4.2 is vulnerable to SQL injection in chart data requests. Users should update to 1.4.2 or higher which addresses this issue.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-27479
  • https://lists.apache.org/thread/94th50j5d0y2fw7ysx0g7w3t6jk3z7q6
  • https://lists.apache.org/thread/ztb9b6jd9rngoxwvq8r4fhpp401o613y
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/04/13/3
  • https://github.com/pypa/advisory-database/tree/main/vulns/apache-superset/PYSEC-2022-188.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wh73-hpcg-v32j

entry.title: [tensorflow-gpu] `CHECK` failure in depthwise ops via overflows
entry.content:
Impact

The implementation of depthwise ops in TensorFlow is vulnerable to a denial of service via CHECK-failure (assertion failure) caused by overflowing the number of elements in a tensor:

import tensorflow as tf

input = tf.constant(1, shape=[1, 4, 4, 3], dtype=tf.float32)
filter_sizes = tf.constant(1879048192, shape=[13], dtype=tf.int32)
out_backprop = tf.constant(1, shape=[1, 4, 4, 3], dtype=tf.float32)
tf.raw_ops.DepthwiseConv2dNativeBackpropFilter(
    input=input, filter_sizes=filter_sizes, out_backprop=out_backprop, strides=[1, 1, 1, 1], padding="SAME")

This is another instance of TFSA-2021-198 (CVE-2021-41197).

Patches

We have patched the issue in GitHub commit 3796cc4fcd93ae55812a457abc96dcd55fbb854b.

The fix will be included in TensorFlow 2.9.0. We will also cherrypick this commit on TensorFlow 2.8.1, TensorFlow 2.7.2, and TensorFlow 2.6.4, as these are also affected and still in supported range.

For more information

Please consult our security guide for more information regarding the security model and how to contact us with issues and questions.

Attribution

This vulnerability has been reported by Neophytos Christou from Secure Systems Lab at Brown University.

References

  • https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/security/advisories/GHSA-mw6j-hh29-h379
  • https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/3796cc4fcd93ae55812a457abc96dcd55fbb854b
  • https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/security/advisory/tfsa-2021-198.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mw6j-hh29-h379

filter_sizes = tf.constant(1879048192, shape=[13], dtype=tf.int32)

    input=input, filter_sizes=filter_sizes, out_backprop=out_backprop, strides=[1, 1, 1, 1], padding="SAME")

entry.title: [ansible] Exposure of Sensitive Information in ansible
entry.content:
A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine 2.9.18, where sensitive info is not masked by default and is not protected by the no_log feature when using the sub-option feature of the basic.py module. This flaw allows an attacker to obtain sensitive information. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-20228
  • https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/73487
  • https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/73492
  • https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/73493
  • https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/73494
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1925002
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4950
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5rrg-rr89-x9mv

entry.title: [ansible] Exposure of Sensitive Information in ansible
entry.content:
A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine 2.9.18, where sensitive info is not masked by default and is not protected by the no_log feature when using the sub-option feature of the basic.py module. This flaw allows an attacker to obtain sensitive information. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-20228
